reviews.text:
Staff is friendly and helpful. Convenient location near metro station and port. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as the piazza with shopping.
OK for rooms and breakfast. Older rooms that have been patched up. For the price, there may be better options available.

We stayed at the hotel for one night and did not regret our booking. Good location, nice rooms, friendly staff and very good service. Only the bathroom was a bit small, but if that's the only negative thing you notice, that says a lot. Thank you very much!

All was great, I would recommend. Best location in the city, several touristic places around and full of restaurants. The staff was very nice, the view from the roof terrace is great. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Solid Mercure Hotel, room size okay, clean, bathroom rather small.

Rooms facing the street can hear traffic noise all night long.

The airport bus - Alibus has its stop 5 minutes walk away at the harbor.  Don't change to the metro at the main station as the Google route planner suggests, it's unnecessary and takes longer. Just drive through to the end of the bus line.

If you are a guest at the hotel on a beautiful sunny day, what you won't easily forget is the rich breakfast served on the large terrace with a view of the port and the Maschio Angioino. You'll also remember pastiera napoletana and sfogliatelle, but above all, the kindness and smile of the entire staff. The rooms are simple yet elegant. The hotel offers also a small gym and a sleek cocktail bar to its guests. The price vs quality ratio is definitely fair.
